DOC.brief_title: An Internet Cognitive-Behavioral Intervention Youth With Type 1 Diabetes - Participation Efficacy
DOC.detailed_description: Adolescents often reluctant receive psychological help . The investigator develop web-based cognitive behavioral self-help intervention adolescent type 1 diabetes . The investigator aim examine participation rate outcome glycemic control quality life . Single center study conduct describe participation efficacy internet cognitive-behavioral intervention youth type 1 diabetes . Adolescents type 1 diabetes , age 13-20 year , treat Juvenile Diabetes Center , offer participate intervention . Recruitment period last 2 month , January-February , 2011 . HbA1c measure adolescent agree participate , obtain medical records.The adolescent , log , ask complete questionnaire intervention assess expectation program , quality life parental support . After completion questionnaire , adolescent encourage complete 6 virtual session . Satisfaction assess session . In end program , participant ask complete questionnaire . HbA1c level obtain participant log , participant passively refuse , 3 month recruitment .
DOC.criteria: diagnosis diabetes least 1 year treat Juvenile Diabetes Center fluent Hebrew speakers previous diagnosis psychiatric condition ( eat disorder ) opposition internet due religious issue .
